page.title: 08EMPLOYMENT IN THEDDINGWORTH
page.content: Half the population of the village is over 60 or under 18. Of the approximately 100 who are of working age, most go out to work, although 10% work from home. Nearly half the wives of working age go out to work or work from home. The working population is employed in a great variety of activities - over 50 different jobs being listed by the villagers who responded to our questionnaire. The kinds of work done can be grouped as follows: Agriculture & Horticulture 20% Industry 14% Sales 13% Medical & Social Services 13% Own Business 10% Education & Research 10% Office 8% Transport 7% Construction Industry 5%
